tit.e: Kishamitsumono': 3 forms of traditional Japanese horseback archery
Kishamitsumono': 3 forms of traditional Japanese horseback archery
tit.cmt: クォーテーション削除、以下説明があるため、Kishamitusmonoのみとしました。

sen.j: 騎射三物（きしゃみつもの）とは馬上の弓術、犬追物・笠懸・流鏑馬を総称して言ったもの。
sen.e: Kishamitsumono'is a general term that refers to forms of traditional Japanese horseback archery:'Inu omono' (dog hunt), 'Yabusame' (shooting at fixed targets) and, 'Kasakake'(shooting at suspended targets at closer range).

Kishamitsumono'is a general term that refers to forms of traditional Japanese horseback archery:'Inu omono' (dog hunt), 'Yabusame' (shooting at fixed targets) and, 'Kasakake'(shooting at suspended targets at closer range).

Kishamitsumono' is a general term that refers to forms of traditional Japanese horseback archery:'Inu oumono' (dog hunt), 'Yabusame' (shooting at fixed targets), and 'Kasagake' (shooting at suspended targets at closer range).
sen.cmt: 全角表記→半角に修正、Inu omono→Inu oumono、Kasakake→Kasagakeとし、クォーテーション修正、カンマの位置移動

sen.j: 元々は武者が騎乗から敵を射抜くための稽古法で、それぞれ平安時代〜鎌倉時代に成立する。
sen.e: The archery forms came into eｘistence between the Heian and Kamakura periods and were originally used as a method for warriors on horseback to practice shooting the enemy.
The archery forms came into eｘistence between the Heian and Kamakura periods and were originally used as a method for warriors on horseback to practice shooting the enemy.
The archery forms came into existence between the Heian and Kamakura periods and were originally used as a method for warriors on horseback to practice shooting the enemy.

sen.j: 武士の中でも騎乗が許されるのは一部の武士のみということもある。
sen.e: Only a select number of ｗarriors ｗere ｐermitted to ride on horseback.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Only a select number of ｗarriors ｗere ｐermitted to ride on horseback.
Only a select number of warriors were permitted to ride on horseback.

sen.j: 馬上の弓術『騎射』は武芸の中でも最高位のものとされる。
sen.e: Archery whilst mounted on horseback was considered as one of the highest forms of martial arts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Archery whilst mounted on horseback was considered as one of the highest forms of martial arts.
Archery whilst mounted on horseback was considered as one of the highest forms of martial arts.

sen.j: 中世の武士達は武芸練達のために様々な稽古をした。
sen.e: During medieval times, Japanese warriors used to practice martial arts in a variety of ways.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During medieval times, Japanese warriors used to practice martial arts in a variety of ways.
During medieval times, Japanese warriors used to practice martial arts in a variety of ways.

sen.j: 『騎射』稽古で上記３つは代表的な稽古法であり、総称してこう呼ばれる。
sen.e: The three methods mentioned above of practicing archery on horseback are considered representative and, are designated by a general term 'Kisha' (horseback archery) in Jaｐanese.
The three methods mentioned above of practicing archery on horseback are considered representative and, are designated by a general term 'Kisha' (horseback archery) in Jaｐanese.
The three methods mentioned above of practicing archery on horseback are considered representative, and are designated by a general term "Kisha" (horseback archery) in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 全角表記→半角に修正、カンマの位置移動、‘Kisha’→"Kisha"に修正

sen.j: 近代までにそれぞれ独立した競技、儀礼的神事として作法や規則が整備された。
sen.e: In seｐarate comｐetitions， the rules and etiｑuette of each of the forms has been maintained through to ｐresent times．
In seｐarate comｐetitions， the rules and etiｑuette of each of the forms has been maintained through to ｐresent times．
In separate competitions, the rules and etiquette of each of the forms has been maintained through to present times.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 犬追物
sen.e: Inu omono': dog hunting
Inu omono': dog hunting
Inu Oumono
sen.cmt: Oumonoとし、全角表記→半角に修正、クォーテーション・補足削除

sen.j: 40間（約73m）四方の馬場に、1組12騎として3組、計36騎の騎手、検分者（審判）を2騎、喚次役（呼び出し）を2騎用意し、犬150匹を離しその犬を追いかけ何匹射たかを競う。
sen.e: On a riding ground that extended ７３ meters in each direction, 3 groups made up of 12 horsemen in each group (a total of 36 riders) and 2 other riders acting as referees and 2 other riders acting as marshals chased after and competed to shoot 150 released dogs.

On a riding ground that extended ７３ meters in each direction, 3 groups made up of 12 horsemen in each group (a total of 36 riders) and 2 other riders acting as referees and 2 other riders acting as marshals chased after and competed to shoot 150 released dogs.

On a riding ground that extended 73 meters in each direction, three groups made up of 12 horsemen in each group (a total of 36 riders) and two other riders acting as referees and two other riders acting as marshals chased after and competed to shoot 150 released dogs.
sen.cmt: 全角表記→半角に修正、2, 3をスペルアウト

sen.j: 矢は神頭矢と呼ばれる刃の付いていない矢を使用する。
sen.e: The arrows used were called `Kantoya` and had no arrowhead affixed.
The arrows used were called `Kantoya` and had no arrowhead affixed.
The arrows used were called 'Kantoya' and had no arrowhead affixed.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション表記修正、スペースを半角に修正

sen.j: 手間や費用がかかる事、動物保護の観点から現在では行われていない。
sen.e: The event is no longer held due to the expense and difficulty in arranging, along with animal protection concerns.
The event is no longer held due to the expense and difficulty in arranging, along with animal protection concerns.
The event is no longer held due to the expense and difficulty in arranging, along with animal protection concerns.

sen.j: 詳細は『犬追物』項参照。
sen.e: For details refer to the listing on 'Inu omono' (dog hunting).
For details refer to the listing on 'Inu omono' (dog hunting).
For details refer to the listing on "Inu Oumono" (dog hunting).
sen.cmt: ‘Ｉｎｕ ｏｍｏｎｏ‘→"Inu Oumono"に修正、スペースを半角に修正

sen.j: 笠懸
sen.e: `Kasakake`(shooting at suspended targets at varying ranges)
`Kasakake`(shooting at suspended targets at varying ranges)
Kasagake
sen.cmt: Kasagakeとし、クォーテーション・補足削除

sen.j: 的の配置に左右、高低、大小と変化を付けた的を馬を疾走させつつ射抜く。
sen.e: Typically, archers shoot at targets varying in height, size and placement (somewhat left or right) and, typically from a galloping horse.
Typically, archers shoot at targets varying in height, size and placement (somewhat left or right) and, typically from a galloping horse.
Typically, archers shoot at targets varying in height, size and placement (somewhat left or right) and, typically from a galloping horse.

sen.j: 流鏑馬より難易度が高く、より実戦的である。
sen.e: Kasakake'is more difficult than `Yabusame` and closer to actual combat.
Kasakake'is more difficult than `Yabusame` and closer to actual combat.
Kasagake is more difficult than Yabusame and closer to actual combat.
sen.cmt: Kasagakeとし、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 詳細は『笠懸』項参照。
sen.e: For details refer to the listing on `Kasakake`.
For details refer to the listing on `Kasakake`.
For details refer to the listing on "Kasagake."
sen.cmt: `Kasakake`→"Kasagake"に修正、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 流鏑馬
sen.e: Yabusame': shooting at fixed targets whilst on horseback
Yabusame': shooting at fixed targets whilst on horseback
Yabusame
sen.cmt: クォーテーション・補足削除

sen.j: 距離2町（約218m）の直線馬場に、騎手の進行方向左手に３つの的を用意する。
sen.e: Three targets are positioned on the left hand side of the archer on horseback who proceeds down a 218 meter long straight track.
Three targets are positioned on the left hand side of the archer on horseback who proceeds down a 218 meter long straight track.
Three targets are positioned on the left hand side of the archer on horseback who proceeds down a 218 meter long straight track.

sen.j: 騎手は馬を全力疾走させながら３つの的を連続して射抜く。
sen.e: The horseman gallops his steed at full tilt while shooting at the three targets in succession.
The horseman gallops his steed at full tilt while shooting at the three targets in succession.
The horseman gallops his steed at full tilt while shooting at the three targets in succession.

sen.j: 現在でも日本各地の流鏑馬神事として行われている。
sen.e: Even to this day, `Yabusame` events are held temples in various parts of Japan.
Even to this day, `Yabusame` events are held temples in various parts of Japan.
Even to this day, Yabusame events are held temples in various parts of Japan.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 詳細は『流鏑馬』項参照。
sen.e: For details refer to the listing on ` Yabusame `.
For details refer to the listing on ` Yabusame `.
For details refer to the listing on "Yabusame."
sen.cmt: ` Yabusame `→"Yabusame"に修正、ピリオドの位置を移動
